value: Center of Pilsen with the St. Bartholomew Cathedral

. It is the home and birthplace of the Pilsener (or pilsner) beer variety which is derived from the city's name. 

It is the 4th largest city in the country and the largest city in West Bohemia, being a convenient base for exploring this region of the Czech Republic.
, bus and train are the easy options of getting there. Trains leave from Prague's main train station (
) on an hourly basis during daytime. Buses leave frequently from Prague's terminus metro station

(line B). The trip takes approximately an hour and 40 minutes by train and about an hour by bus.

value: - the Gothic St. Bartholomew's Cathedral was founded in the late 13th century, its tower (102.26 m / 335 ft) being the highest in the Czech Republic. Official website
- this Renaissance masterpiece was built in 1554-1559, based on the designs of an Italian architect, Giovanni de Statia.
- a sophisticated system of cellars and tunnels of up to three levels under the whole Old Town area. It is accessible from the Brewery Museum in Veleslavínova street. Official website
- the second largest synagogue in Europe and third largest in the world (after synagogues in Jerusalem and Budapest).
content=Founded in 1842, home to the Pilsner Urquell, the original Pilsener.
- home to over one thousand species of animals in natural conditions without bars. Official website
Ethnography Museum of the Pilsen Region
(Borská street, http://www.techmania.cz) - Modern interactive museum on the premises of the Škoda factory.

(sady Pětatřicátníků) - The only American Army museum in Bohemia, opened on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Pilsen and South-West Bohemia. It features the stay of the American soldiers in the region May through November 1945.
(nám. Republiky 33, http://www.muzeumstrasidel.cz) - The exhibition features the themes of fairy-tale worlds and legends. Recommended especially for children.

(nám. Republiky 24, http://www.muzeumloutek.cz) - Located in the completely adapted historical house No. 24 in the Square of the Republic, the Puppet Museum is expected to be opened in 2009. Exhibitions and workshops will map the unique history and present of Pilsen puppetry and offer interactive activities for both children and adult visitors.

(Kopeckého sady 2, http://www.zcm.cz/index.php?page=zbrojnice) - it ranks among the best preserved armouries of the European medieval towns. Its origin dates back to the year 1363 when the Emperor Charles IV was building armouries in a planned manner in the royal Czech towns to provide for their readiness. Globally outstanding is the oldest part which includes a set of firearms from the turn of the 14th century. An extensive set of battlement guns with simple fuse systems was created in the first half of the 16th century. The firearms collection is completed historically by muskets from the Thirty-Year War period. Cold weapons are represented in the armoury by morgenstern  from the 15th century and arquebuses from the 16th and 17th centuries. The armours of Plzeň burghers are represented by a great number of chest and back plates, shoulder and arm protecting plates, as well as many helmets of different types.

(Františkánská street) - Exposition of Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque sculptures in the cloister of the Franciscan monastery, chapel of St. Barbara with Gothic frescos, exhibition hall in the Baroque monastic refectory. Museum temporarily closed.
Walk through the city parks that circle the historical city center on its two sides.
Enjoy the view of the city and its surrounding areas from the church tower of the St. Bartholomew's Cathedral.
Enjoy a drink of Pilsner Urquell in the city that gave its name to all the pilseners in the world.
name=Jet fighter flight in Czech Republic
price=€1999 for a flight including all preparations
content=Very nice but rather expensive experience. Starting from an Airbase close to Plzeň. The customer can fly the jet under watch of the pilot.

There are several events during the year.

value: - around May 6th, when the city of Pilsen was liberated from Nazi Germany by the George Patton's 3rd Army in 1945. The city is full of music and other culture.
- This summer festival is hold in the park behind the Plzen Plaza the last weekend of July. More info at
- generally in the first half of August. Small stages around the city center, a big stage on the Square of Republic. Music, theater and street performances.
- the biggest and most famous beer festival in the Czech Republic takes place every year around September when Pilsner Urquell Brewery celebrates its birthday (in 2010 already on August 27-28)
content=The biggest restaurant in the Czech Republic with 550 seats. Within the grounds of the Prazdroj brewery
(Martinská 1) - a big restaurant, good selection of meals and drinks
(Riegrova 5) - a stylish Czech restaurant, good meals
(Pražská 8) - the oldest beer restaurant in Pilsen serving Czech traditional cuisine
(Bezručova 9) - both Czech and international (especially Mediterranean) cuisine
(Jungmannova 4) - healthy bio cuisine including vegetarian and vegan cuisine
(Americká 13) – vegetarian dishes, vegetable salads and soups
(nám. Republiky 18) - French fast food (soups, salads, quiche ...)
(Veleslavinova 4) - the pub to get truly excellent unfiltered Urquell
(Poděbradova 12) - microbrewery with home-brewed beer and good Czech cuisine

Pilsen is the city where the pilsner beer was invented.
is the famous beer brand of Pilsen. In a few pubs (Senk Na Parkanu) and at the brewery itself, you can get the
, unpasteurized version of Pilsner Urquell, which tastes even better that the common filtered version. Another brand made in the same brewery is
. Gambrinus Light (desitka) is probably the most common beer in the Czech Republic, and it's cheaper and weaker than Pilsner Urquell.

value: (Kopeckého sady 13) - a luxurious Art Noveau style café
(Jungmannova 5) - good coffee and some small stuff to eat (sandwiches, salads, yogurts ...)
(Anglické nábřeží 1) - coffee and something to eat as well
(Bezručova 7) - coffee and chocolate house with music
(Prokopova 17) - café and teahouse employing people with disabilities as part of a therapy
(Sady Pětatřicátníků 2) - a stylish New Age-like teahouse
(Palackého nám. 2) - Irish pub with music club, regular music production
(Kollárova 20) - regular live music, movie projections, theater performances
(Sedláčkova 18) - a place to chill, live music, groovy-jazzy-funky
